MFA French Film Festival  -- Le festival du film français

Allons ensemble au cinéma! Au programme, un film de Philippe Claudel -

Silence of Love (Tous les soleils) by Philippe Claudel (2010, 105 min.). Alessandro is a music professor at the University of Strasbourg and lives with his teenage daughter, Irina.  Alessandro devotes all his time to his daughter, but their relationship is strained when she enters high school. Alessandro’s sanity is further put to the test when his brother Luigi, a fugitive from Berlusconi's Italy, moves in. Despite being a talented and sought after painter, Luigi refuses to sell his paintings to “capitalists,” and cannot help Alessandro with the rent. Alessandro’s luck changes when he meets the beautiful Florence who turns his outlook around. A playful mix of French and Italian culture, Silence of Love was an audience favorite in France this spring.
